incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating an issue that causes logs to stop processing for certain apps.

incidents.name: SIN network issues affected edges and wireguard gateways

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

An outage in SIN from an upstream network provider is causing issues with Wireguard gateways. If you are having trouble deploying or accessing your private network from a Wireguard peer in SIN, you'll likely need to temporarily create a peer in a different region.

Edges are affected as well, but traffic has been re-routed.

Between 14:30-16:15 UTC, a widespread Comcast/Xfinity network outage affected connectivity in several regions including `lax`, `bos`, `ewr`, and `atl`, causing network interruptions to applications and deployments in these regions. The issue seems to have been resolved.

incidents.name: Machines API degraded - returning 504s for a small number of requests

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The Machines API (aka flaps) is returning 504 responses for a small number of requests. This may affect a small number of apps v2 deployments. Engineers are working to address the issue.
We have added a new region (BOM - Mumbai, India) to mitigate the capacity issues in MAA. At this time we suggest deploying workloads to BOM instead of MAA.

We are continuing to monitor the situation. 

Due to ongoing capacity constraints in MAA we recommend migrating your workloads to the alternative BOM region.

Your apps in MAA will continue to run, but it is no longer possible to create new Machines in this region.

Due to ongoing capacity constraints in MAA, we have built a new nearby region in BOM and recommend migrating your workloads there.

Your apps in MAA will continue to run, but it is no longer possible to create new Machines in this region.
We are currently working to add more capacity to MAA.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been deployed and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified an issue causing app metrics to stop being collected from some Machines that have been created/updated in the last ~24 hours, and we're working on deploying a fix.

incidents.name: registry.fly.io pulls failing from some hosts in iad

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have investigated an issue with some hosts failing to pull images from registry.fly.io in iad. A quick fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitor.
This incident has been resolved.

We've rolled back some infrastructure changes that may have allowed the registry to leak connections. Registry errors have returned to normal levels, and deploys are functioning properly in all regions.
The registry is rejecting connections from some hosts in some regions. We're restarting processes, which seems to be helping reduce the error rate.
We are investigating an increased rate of image pull failures in a handful of regions. These are interfering with some customer deploys, and show as a failed VM in `fly status`.
Metrics issues have been resolved.
We've increased the limits for metrics ingestion across the impacted cluster and are monitoring recovery.
Currently investigating problems with metrics ingestion. It looks like querying metrics still works.
This incident has been resolved.
We have noticed consistently high demand in the SJC region and are provisioning additional capacity.

We are continuing to work on enabling deployments for Apps V1 in CDG.

incidents.name: Increased WebSockets errors in FRA, IAD, EWR and YUL

incident_updates.body: A regression in our proxy code caused an increase in WebSocket errors in several regions. Apps experiencing these issues showed variants of "Message too long (error 90)" in their application logs.
The registry is fully restored.
We are still not seeing any new issues reported and are planning to re-deploy the registry again to ensure all issues from earlier have been resolved.
The registry has been recovered from a previous version and we've re-enabled deploys as we continue to monitor for new issues.
Users may also see an increase in error rates when attempting to create or update machines using the API.
We've identified the issue and are working to rollback the most recent deploy of the registry.
We're seeing an increased number of errors or timeouts when pushing images to registry.fly.io during deploys.

incidents.name: Packet loss from Singapore to multiple regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are working to route around multiple fiber cuts that are currently affecting singapore.
We're working with our providers to bypass a bad route.
Causing intermittent issues deploying to SIN.
This incident has been resolved.
Our Consul cluster is now stable again. We've re-enabled Nomad deployments and are monitoring for any further issues.
The Consul cluster rebuild is nearly completed and we are working to restore service.
The Consul cluster rebuild is nearly completed and we are working to restore service.

We are working to build a new Consul cluster with 10x the RAM. We aren't yet sure, but believe a routine DNS change might have created a thundering herd problem causing Consul servers to immediately increase RAM usage by 500%. This is not ideal.
We're still working on recovering our Consul cluster.
Our Consul cluster is experiencing an outage. This impacts queries to our API, including creating and modifying apps, as well as incoming network requests for recently deployed apps.

incidents.name: CDG host did not restart cleanly, preventing instances with volumes to start

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
CDG instances with volumes are now back.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.
We currently have deploys enabled while we monitor Nomad's backlog.
We've disabled deploys again to allow nomad to catch up on its Job Evalutations.
Nomad is working through a backlog of job evaluations, this is slowing deploys to the point where they're failing in many cases.
We've restored our Nomad server cluster (now with 10x the RAM) and are re-enabling deploy functionality.

We are working to restore the Nomad server cluster. Our current priority is restoring Nomad without disrupting running applications. There is a chance this is unsuccessful, and applications reboot unexpectedly when we get Nomad back online.

We have temporarily disabled Apps V1 deploys.

Our Apps V1 platform is currently operating in a severely degraded state. Apps that are already running will stay running, but any changes to VM state will fail, including deploys. This is a result of capacity issues in our underlying nomad cluster. An attempt to grow our cluster has left it in a bad state which we are working to correct.

Our API is also being impacted and will be intermittently available until the Apps V1 platform is restored.

incidents.name: Deployment monitoring and app status have stale data

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Things are better but deploys / release commands are still slower than they should be. Instance statuses are also delayed a bit as our state is synchronizing.
We've upped the memory allocated for that app so it doesn't crash anymore and it seems a lot more stable now.

A synchronization service we are running crashing from time to time causing deployment monitoring to fail at times and app status to show erroneous information about instances.

The cause of the crash has not yet been determined.

incidents.name: Apps V1 Instances are sometimes, wrongly, being stopped without user intervention

incident_updates.body: Bigger servers in place, Nomad is running healthily.
We are provisioning far bigger servers to handle the increased workload our Nomad cluster has seen these past months.
Removing the server from the cluster seems to have helped with this issue temporarily.
Our nomad cluster has consistency issues right now due to one of the servers at the limits of its resources. This seems to have an effect on apps V1.
